means: <非正>（剧院后部的）最高层楼座
受到过分崇尚（或推崇）的事物

sentence.Network_en: The world of the gods is anthropomorphic, an imitative projection of ours.
sentence.Network_cn: 神界是拟人化的，是模仿我们人类世界的一个投影。

sentence.Network_en: The great magicians of old always invoked their gods with sacrifice.
sentence.Network_cn: 旧时一些有名的巫师经常以祭品祈求他们所供奉神灵的助佑。

sentence.Network_en: Sacrifices were made to propitiate the gods.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们供奉祭品以求神灵息怒。

上古之神（Old Gods）【又名：阿卡（aka），上古存在（Old Ones），古老之神（Elder Gods），往昔存在（Elder Beings），黑暗 …

entry.def: The name God is given to the spirit or being who is worshipped as the creator and ruler of the world, especially by Jews, Christians, and Muslims.

example.ex: He believes in God...
example.tran: 他信奉上帝。

example.ex: God bless you.
example.tran: 上帝保佑你。

entry.tran: （表示强调所说的话，或表示惊讶、恐惧或激动）啊呀，天啊，天哪（可能具冒犯意味）
entry.def: People sometimes use God in exclamations to emphasize something that they are saying, or to express surprise, fear, or excitement. This use could cause offence.

example.ex: God, how I hated him!...
example.tran: 啊呀！我恨死他了！

example.ex: Oh my God he's shot somebody...
example.tran: 我的天哪！他开枪打人了。

entry.def: In many religions, a god is one of the spirits or beings that are believed to have power over a particular part of the world or nature.

example.ex: ...Pan, the God of nature.
example.tran: 自然之神，潘

example.ex: ...Zeus, king of the gods.
example.tran: 众神之王，宙斯

entry.tran: 极受尊崇的人；影响极大的人
entry.def: Someone who is admired very much by a person or group of people, and who influences them a lot, can be referred to as a god .

example.ex: To his followers he was a god.
example.tran: 在追随者眼中，他就是神。

entry.tran: 愿上帝阻止这样的事情；但愿这样的事不会发生
entry.def: If you say God forbid, you are expressing your hope that something will not happen.

example.ex: If, God forbid, something goes wrong, I don't know what I would do.
example.tran: 如果哪儿出点儿岔子，我会不知所措的，但愿这样的事情不会发生。

entry.tran: 上帝的恩赐；十全十美的人
entry.def: If a person thinks they are God's gift to someone or something, they think they are perfect or extremely good.

example.ex: Are men god's gift to women? Some of them think they are.
example.tran: 男人是上帝赐予女人的礼物吗？有些男人就是这样认为的。

entry.def: You use God help you to warn someone that something unpleasant will happen to them if they do a particular thing.

example.ex: God help him if he gets in my way...
example.tran: 他要是跟我作对，那就让上帝保佑他吧。

example.ex: The boss says you must wear a tie. And God help you if you don't.
example.tran: 老板说你得打领带，如果不听你会倒霉的。

entry.def: If you feel sorry for someone because they are in a difficult or unpleasant situation, especially if you think that nobody can help them, you can say God help them.

example.ex: 'God help them,' he said. 'They're  beyond help.'
example.tran: “愿上帝保佑他们吧，”他说，“谁也帮不了他们了。”

entry.def: If you say God help us, you mean that you have negative feelings about the person or situation you are talking about.

example.ex: The first song is 11 minutes long, the last nearly the same, and, God help us, there's a drum solo along the way.
example.tran: 第一首歌有11分钟长，最后一首也差不多长，唉，上帝啊，中间还有一个击鼓独奏。

entry.tran: （表示强调）只有上帝知道，天晓得
entry.def: You can say God knows ,God only knows, or God alone knows to emphasize that you do not know something.

example.ex: Gunga spoke God knows how many languages...
example.tran: 天晓得贡嘎会讲多少门语言。

example.ex: God alone knows what she thinks.
example.tran: 只有天晓得她在想什么。

entry.def: If someone says God knows in reply to a question, they mean that they do not know the answer.

example.ex: 'Where is he now?' 'God knows.'
example.tran: “他现在在哪里？”“天晓得。”

entry.def: The term a man of God is sometimes used to refer to Christian priests or ministers.

example.ex: I am a man of God.
example.tran: 我是个牧师。

entry.tran: （用来强调生气、懊恼或吃惊）究竟什么/ 究竟为什么/究竟如何
entry.def: If someone uses such expressions as what in God's name ,why in God's name, or how in God's name, they are emphasizing how angry, annoyed, or surprised they are.

example.ex: What in God's name do you expect me to do?...
example.tran: 你究竟要我做什么？

example.ex: Why in God's name did you have to tell her?
example.tran: 为什么你非得告诉她呢？

entry.tran: 俨然一副上帝的样子；表现得无所不能
entry.def: If someone plays God, they act as if they have unlimited power and can do anything they want.

example.ex: You have no right to play God in my life!
example.tran: 你无权对我的人生指手画脚！

entry.tran: （强调愿望之强烈）老天保佑，求求上天帮忙
entry.def: You say please God to emphasize a strong hope, wish, or desire that you have.

example.ex: Please God, let him telephone me now.
example.tran: 拜托老天了，让他现在就给我来个电话吧。

entry.tran: （表示强调）我向上帝祈祷/我真诚地希望/我向上帝发誓
entry.def: You can use God in expressions such as I hope to God, or I wish to God, or I swear to God, in order to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: I hope to God they are paying you well...
example.tran: 我真希望他们给你一份好的酬劳。

example.ex: I wish to God I hadn't met you.
example.tran: 我真希望我不曾认识你。

entry.def: If you say God willing, you are saying that something will happen if all goes well.

example.ex: God willing, there will be a breakthrough.
example.tran: 如果一切顺利，将会取得突破性的进展。

auth_sentence.content: Karnak Temple in Luxor is dedicated to the gods.
auth_sentence.res_content: Karnak Temple in Luxor is dedicated to the gods.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Karnak Temple in Luxor is dedicated to the gods.

auth_sentence.content: Pharaohs were go-betweens for the gods and the people.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pharaohs were go-betweens for the gods and the people.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pharaohs were go-betweens for the gods and the people.

auth_sentence.content: Suicide is not part of Gods Plan for us.
auth_sentence.res_content: Suicide is not part of Gods Plan for us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Suicide is not part of Gods Plan for us.
